author: rhuijben
msg: Use the skipped_tree hash in the update editor only for what it was
originally designed. After introducing the skip booleans in the last
few patches we don't need the double administration of deleted trees.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(in_skipped_tree): Remove unused function.
(open_directory,
open_file): Don't store deleted trees as skipped trees.
(close_edit): Don't remove the deleted trees from the skipped trees.

author: rhuijben
msg: Move checks for tree conflicts on files together in a single if block.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(add_file): Remove temporary variable.
(open_file): Collapse a few if blocks. Slight functional change: this code
now adds a path in to the deleted_trees hash even if it is a sub-path of
an existing entry, but this makes no difference to the users of the hash.

author: stsp
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(dir_baton): Fix typo in comment.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(merge_in_new_file_and_diff):
Following up on r39680, use '/' as path separator in expected diff
output, to fix this test on Windows.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/dirent_uri-test.c
(test_dirent_is_absolute): Following up on r39690, don't assume there is a
valid x: drive on Windows systems. We already assume there is a C: in other
tests, so use that drive here too.
